meanings.definition: Having many ledges or projecting parts.
meanings.sent1: The mountain path was ledgy, with lots of flat areas to rest on.
meanings.sent2: The cliff was ledgy, making it difficult to climb without proper gear.
meanings.sent3: The ledgy terrain made it perfect for a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed off the ledgy walls of the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The ledgy surface of the rock provided ample space for the climbers to grip.

meanings.definition: Resembling a ledge in form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf had a ledgy design, with small shelves jutting out.
meanings.sent2: The building had a ledgy facade, giving it a unique appearance.
meanings.sent3: The ledgy pattern on the wallpaper created an optical illusion.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a ledgy look, with layers cascading down like steps.
meanings.sent5: The ledgy outline of the sculpture added depth and texture to the artwork.
